Catalano.Imaging.Tools

Class DocumentSkewChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • Catalano.Imaging.Tools.DocumentSkewChecker

  • public class DocumentSkewChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    Skew angle checker for scanned documents.
    Author:
    Diego Catalano

    • Method Detail

      • getStepsPerDegree

        public int getStepsPerDegree()
        Get steps per degree.
        Returns:
        Steps per degree.

      • setStepsPerDegree

        public void setStepsPerDegree(int stepsPerDegree)
        Set steps per degree, [1, 10]. The value defines quality of Hough transform and its ability to detect line slope precisely. Default value is set to 1.
        Parameters:
        stepsPerDegree - Steps per degree.

      • getMaxSkewToDetect

        public double getMaxSkewToDetect()
        Get maximum skew angle to detect. Default value is set to 30.
        Returns:
        Maximum skew angle to detect.

      • setMaxSkewToDetect

        public void setMaxSkewToDetect(double maxSkewToDetect)
        Maximum skew angle to detect, [0, 45] degrees. The value sets maximum document's skew angle to detect. Document's skew angle can be as positive (rotated counter clockwise), as negative (rotated clockwise). So setting this value to 25, for example, will lead to [-25, 25] degrees detection range. Scanned documents usually have skew in the [-20, 20] degrees range.
        Parameters:
        maxSkewToDetect - Maximum skew to detect.

      • getLocalPeakRadius

        public int getLocalPeakRadius()
        Get local peak radius. Default value is set to 4.
        Returns:
        Local peak radius.

      • setLocalPeakRadius

        public void setLocalPeakRadius(int localPeakRadius)
        Radius for searching local peak value, [1, 10]. The value determines radius around a map's value, which is analyzed to determine if the map's value is a local maximum in specified area.
        Parameters:
        localPeakRadius - Local peak radius.

      • getSkewAngle

        public double getSkewAngle(FastBitmap fastBitmap)
        Get skew angle of the provided document image.
        Parameters:
        fastBitmap - FastBitmap.
        Returns:
        Returns document's skew angle. If the returned angle equals to -90, then document skew detection has failed.
